column3: Which word in the following sentence is a transitive verb: "Having gone through the letter, it was obvious he was guilty"?
are the two main categories of verbal communication?
Which of the following groups of words qualifies as a sentence?
Inspite of all his efforts to pass the examination
Having gone through the estimates presented at the meeting last week
He hasn't seen any of his friends and foes around.
The three communication models you have studied in this course are ?
Proactive model, Active model and Post-active model
Constructive Model, Reconstructive model and Destructive model
Intra-personal model, Inter personal model and Mass communication model
Linear model, Interactional model and Transactional model
Which communication model is best illustrated with the soldier parade session?
Which word in the following sentence is a finite verb: "While washing the plates, he told the man to sweep the floor "?
Which of the following is not an advantage of written communication?
The three major categories of internal organizational communication are ?
Public relations, media relations and intra-organizational relations

Which of the following is not among the uses of non-verbal communication?
For purposes of semantics and nomenclature
The two major categories of language skills are ?
Which word(s) in the following sentence ia gerundial noun: "While teaching in the class, the lecturer told the students that dancing is his hobby"?
Which of the following statements is most accurate?
Whereas listening is a passive exercise, hearing is not.
Whereas listening is an active exercise, hearing is not.
Whereas hearing involves selectivity of codes, listening does not.
Which of the following is not a disadvantage of oral communication?
The Four Language skills you have studied in this course are ?
Receptive skills, productive skills, instructive skills and constructive skills
Exceptional skills, interactive skills, discursive skills and transactional skills
An essay is made up of all but one of the following types of paragraph?
Which of the following is true of intensive reading?
It involves reading as much printing materials as possible
It is a reading approach that the reader covers several subject areas at a sitting
A concentrated reading of a relatively short text with the sole aim of full understanding
It is a reading approach that slows down both the speed of the reader and also adversely affects general comprehension of what is being read
Which of the following reading types aims at striking a balance between what a writer has said and what he/she has left unsaid?
Susceptibility to distortion is a disadvantage of which form of communication?
Which of the following terms is most synonymous with summary?
When is communication described as being effective?
when a piece of information is successfully transmitted from the source to the receiver.
when there is an appropriate feedback
when the intention of the message transmitted is realized
What is that undesirable but ever present element in communication?
Which of the following best describes the concept of Communication?
The interaction between two people mainly for transactional purposes
The act of sharing of meaning between two or more people, animals, plants, etc.
The act of processing and transmitting information only through specialized media for specific purposes
The process of discussing issues either in a face to face encounter or through such media of communication as social networks, phones, radio, T.V. etc.
is synonymous with paralanguage as a category of non-verbal communicaton?
Chronemics, as  a category of Non-verbal communication deals with ?
The modification of message in response to feedback is ?
Exchange of views or opinions on an inter-personal communication basis is ?
an example of informal oral communication set-up
an example of formal oral communication set-up
an example of non-verbal communication cue
an advantage of non-verbal communication cue
Which of the following groupings best presents the five major elements of the Communication process?
The columnist, the typesetter, the editor, the channel and the public
The encoder, the message, the channel, the decoder and the feedback
The communicators, the communication environment, the atmosphere, the principal actor and the Issues at stake.
The preambles, the thematic concern of the message, the comprehension prowess and the resolution
The three major categories of organizational communication are?
Vertical, Semi-vertical and Horizontal or Lateral
Which of the following statements is most accurate?
A paragraph is coherent when all the points in the discourse are fully expatiated on within it.
Paragraph completeness refers to a situation where all the key points in a discourse are enumerated within a given paragraph.
The use of parallel structures within a paragraph is architecturally seen as germane to the attainment of coherence.
What makes paragraph a miniature essay is its ability to summarize distinctly all the crucial points or ideas within a given discourse.
Structurally speaking, what type of sentence is the following: "Although the team played well, they could not lift the trophy"?
Functionally speaking, what type of sentence is the following: " Kindly see a doctor!"?
Which of the following statements is not exactly true of an outline?
Though tentative, it is meant to discipline a researcher in order to avoid ambiguity
It is capable of metamorphosing into a full fledge table of contents
Though sketchy and skeletal, all the ideas or points must be organized and arranged within it in a logically sequential order
A situation where a present researcher makes use of another person's materials or ideas without any form of citation or reference is known, in academic circles, as ?
In effective reading, fixation refers to ?
Which of the following is a bad reading habit which must be avoided as a plague, if comprehension must occur?
head movement and wandering thought or digression
sub-vocalization and unnecessary repetition of lines
Which of the following options best expresses the uniqueness of human communication?
Ability to be patient enough to listen to, and understand the viewpoints of the other party.
Ability to create and use symbols
Ability to react and provide feedback
A blend of verbal and non-verbal approaches to communication
What are the key elements of the sentence?
Which punctuation mark is normally used in direct speeches that are not lengthy?
An only example of the neuter-gender pronoun in the subjective case that you know is ?
Which of the following statements is most appropriate?
Every complex sentence must have a co-ordinating conjunction.
Every complex sentence must have a subordinating element.
Every compound sentence must have both subordinating and co-ordinating elements.
Every simple sentence must be characteristically short.
The  tense used to express a habitual action and to state an eternal truth is ?
A narrative essay is characteristically written in which tense?
State what you consider the basic difference between intra-personal communication and soliloquy?
Whereas intra-personal communication occurs within an individual, soliloquy is a direct address to a person(s) for compassion or assistance.

Whereas intra-personal communication is employed to share views or ideas with oneself through sub-vocalization, soliloquy is an incoherent self talkwhich is indicative of an initial stage of derangement.
Whereas intra-personal communication is a natural phenomenon in all normal humans, soliloquy is not natural but merely a dramatic device.
Whereas intra-personal communication occurs within an individual, soliloquy is mostly used to elicit information from a person during an interactive session.
What is your understanding of Grapevine as it relates to organizational communication?
The germination of ideas and concepts and the dissemination of same within an organization through an a systemic approach.
An informal dissemination of information related to the affairs of an organization based on social relationship rather than the organizational communication networks.
A monitored and procedural linkage of information to the occurrences in an organization for the purposes of improved service provision.
A constructive attack and criticism leveled against an organization to better the working condition of workers in such an organization.
Functionally, Which of the folowing is not among the three major types of paragraph are:
The Four main forms of communication that you have studied in this course are ?
Intra-personal, Inter-personal, Small Group and Mass communication
Cross-cultural, Trans-cultural, Inter-cultural and Cultural communication
Political, Cultural, Socio-cultural and Religio-cultural communication
Pre-textual, Contextual, Trans-textual and Inter-textual communication
Which one of the following epithets does not describe the essence of communication?
Kinesics and proxemics, as categories of non-verbal communication, refer to ?
The use of body position and space
The use of time and physical touch
The use of voice pitch and volume for effect
The use of eye contact and signs
Which of the following statements is most accurate?
Whereas scanning involves a quick read for specific idea(s) from a text, skimming entails glancing through it to obtain a general idea of what it is all about
Whereas skimming involves a quick read for specific idea(s) from a text, scanning entails a thorough reading to obtain a detailed idea of what it is all about
Scanning and skimming are synonymous with each other
Both skimming and scanning are not recommended for an efficient reader at all.
Which of the following statements is most appropriate?
An encoder always transmits meaning not message
An encoder always transmit message not meaning
In communication, meaning is the conveyor of the message
Communication is not a process in continuum
Which of these statements is grammatically correct?
Funmi and Kehinde did not greet themselves this morning.
Funmi and Kehinde did not greet each other this morning.
Funmi and Kehinde did not greet one another.
Neither Funmi nor Kehinde greeted the two both of them this morning.
Which of the communication models is described as being mono-directional?
What a day!"Functionally speaking, what type of sentence is this?
Whichever way you lookat it, there is a remarkable improvement in the economic situation of our nation. Structurally speaking, what type of sentence is this?
The word "who" can be used both as interrogative and a relative pronoun. True OR False?
The table fan was stolen last week. The word "table" used in this sentence is a/an ?
In an organization, rumours are purely destructive; and are eradicated in every successful organization, True OR False?
The army parade is best illustrative of which model of communication?
Which communication model is best illustrated with the "ping-pong" table tennis game?
Which of the following is an example of psychological barrier  to communication?
Oral communication is synonymous with non-verbal communication. True OR False?
Transience and tenability are features of oral communication. True OR False?
Semantic barriers are examples of external barriers to effective communication. True OR False?
A sense of integrity and discipline is attributable to which category of non-verbal communication?
Encoder, as an element of communication is the generator of the message to be communicated; and is antonymous to decoder. TRUE OR FALSE

In the sentence " I left so that he could concentrate on his studies", the expression "so that he could concentrate on his studies is an...
The reading skill which involves glancing through a text to get the general idea of what it is all about it called...
In "They prayed before the ceremony started", "before the ceremony started" is an adverbial clause of ...

In … listening, the listener tries to distinguish between the spoken words and the accompanying nonverbal messages     ( )

In "I bought him a car",  the phrase "a car" is … ( )
As sentence elements, the object follows a transitive verb while the complement follows a… verb ( )

The ….outline combines letters and numbers in a hierarchical sequence ( )

…is the punctuation mark that ends of a declarative sentence… ( )

Public relations, advertisement and correspondence are examples of…( )
